data.name: Sample - Active Directory - 2.2.1
data.description: Sample playbooks for "Active Directory" connector. If you are planning to use any of the sample playbooks in your environment, ensure that you clone those playbooks and move them to a different collection, since the sample playbook collection gets deleted during connector upgrade and delete.

workflows.name: Advanced Search
workflows.description: Executes an advanced LDAP query that searches and retrieves AD records based on your custom query.

workflows.name: Reset Password
workflows.description: Resets the password for a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email, or the Distinguished Name (DN) of the user.

workflows.name: Disable Computer
workflows.description: Disables the computer account based on the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer you have specified.

workflows.name: Get All Objects Details
workflows.description: Searches and retrieves all records from AD based on a specified search object, such as user, computer, or group.

arguments.title: Active Directory: Get All Objects Details

workflows.name: Get Specific Object Details
workflows.description: Searches and retrieves records from AD based on a specified search object, such as user, computer, or group. However, this search is limited to the records found for the object name you have specified. For example, if you want to retrieve the records from AD for a specific user, you need to specify the name of the user.

arguments.title: Active Directory: Get Specific Object Details

workflows.name: Remove Group Members
workflows.description: Removes an Active Directory User or Computer as a member from an existing Group in Active Directory based on the Group DN and User or computer DN you have specified.

workflows.name: Add Group Members
workflows.description: Adds an Active Directory User or Computer as a member to an existing Group in Active Directory based on the Group DN and User or computer DN you have specified.

workflows.name: Add Object
workflows.description: Add an object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type in Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Delete Object
workflows.description: Deletes an existing object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type from Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: User > Active Directory > Enrichment
workflows.description: Retrieve the reputation of indicator of type ‘User’ using Active Directory

arguments.operationTitle: Utils: Convert JSON into a HTML Table

conditions.condition: {{(vars.steps.Get_User_Details.status == "Success" and vars.steps.Get_User_Details.data.entries | length > 0) or vars.useMockOutput or vars.foundADDetails}}

routes.name: Get User Details -> Is Reputation Found
Convert Summary to HTML -> Return Output Data
Is Reputation Found -> Convert Summary to HTML
routes.label: Yes

workflows.name: Update Object
workflows.description: Updates an existing object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type in Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Disable User Account
workflows.description: Disables the account of a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user.

workflows.name: Global Search
workflows.description: Searches and retrieves records from AD using global search, based on the specified search object, such as user, computer, group, search attribute, or a search attribute value, such as SamAccount Name, Distinguished Name, Common Name, Display Name, or Email. When you search a record based on a search attribute value, the record from AD is retrieved based on the specified attribute value.

workflows.name: Enable User Account
workflows.description: Enables the account of a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user.

workflows.name: Enable Computer
workflows.description: Enables the specific computer account based on the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer you have specified.
